title: Use VNCViewer instead
comment: This app (Android-VNC-Viewer) is basically unusable.  1. It insists on landscape.  If you want (like me) to use the top portion of the mobile device for viewing the server (target) PC and the bottom portion for keyboard, you're out of luck.  2. It has a silly implementation of typing.  You type into a pop-up field and "send' the text to target PC.  If you want naturally to type into a document open in the target PC, you are out of luck.  3. It cannot handle a mid-session monitor size change of a target virtual PC.  If you want a viewer with NONE of these problems, use VNCViewer (from RealVNC).  The high rating for Android-VNC-Viewer can only be a result of people not having tried alternatives.
